name: Internet Explorer 6 Market Share Finally Falls Under 5% | TechCrunch
caption: techcrunch.com
description: The Internet Explorer 6 death watch continues, but the end is near. Microsoft's ancient browser may still haunt web developers' nightmares, but according to the latest data from Net Applications, its global market share has now finally dipped under 5 percent. Even Microsoft will be qu..

data.message: don't be that optimistic :D read this: (You may soon be developing for 76 browsers) http://www.paulirish.com/2011/browser-market-pollution-iex-is-the-new-ie6/
loooool. i stopped testing compatibility view long time ago :)
Lollll i stopped testing ALL IE :D
I test my websites on all web browsers only, if you know what I mean :)
Mohammad Tayseer you have to make Web Browsers words BOLD :D

It depends on your users. Geography makes this kind of statistics less important (but not totally unimportant). For a large banking app that started 2 years ago, we managed to fire IE6 away by getting statistics of "the main bank website" suggesting that IE6 trend was dropping near 1%, which was the accepted threshold for excluding support.

In other enterprises, the users are forced to use certain version of IE for other apps that only work on these and/or other reasons that are beyond your control. The point is: always get to know which users you expect, and worry about THEIR usage statistics rather than global ones. Like everything engineering, measure "your" conditions.

Another horror story in that regard, another bank (out of the 4 biggest banks of Australia), gives their employees Macbook Air laptops. Imagine that, wow! However, they get Windows XP installed on them!! How crazy! And for certain group policy issues (that work in Chrome mostly well, but had a bug soon to be fixed), they decided to keep IE as main platform, not Chrome or Chrome frame (which is dying anyway).
Macbook Air laptops with XP installed .. Woooooooooooooooooow !!!
Yeah, banks (financial institutions in general) are so full of horror stories, but this one is hard to compete with :D
